basics.name: Kevin Conti
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary:
Kevin grew up in Buffalo, NY before earning a degree in Computer Science from the University of North Carolina at Wilmington. He is a life-learner who loves to build his knowledge of new languages, frameworks, and software design patterns. 
 He is passionate about the benefits of functional programming, and will talk your ear off about the benefits of languages such as Elm and Elixir/Phoenix. 
 While Kevin has a passion for development, he also has a holistic education in sales, marketing, product, and customer support from his time working as a founder at his own startup. 
 Outside of work, he enjoys living in South Florida, where he can bask in the warmth and sun - a BIG upgrade over the Buffalo weather he grew up with!.

work.summary: As both a part-time, then later full-time endeavor, Kevin founded Kevin Conti Enterprises LLC as a holding company for his collection of projects. Throughout his time working on software and software-related projects, Kevin was responsible for:
highlights: Coding four codebases from scratch and maintaining them in production.
Personally selling over $150,000 worth of product over roughly two years, with no BDRs or outside assistance.
Managing a team of multiple long-term contractors, learning how to be a good employer, manager, and leader.

work.summary: SoftPro is the most trusted provider of real estate closing, title and escrow software, with over 14,000 customer sites and 60,000 users nationwide. At SoftPro, Kevin was responsible for:
highlights: Participating in discussions to architect SoftPro's newest cloud-based offering, internally referred to as Project Intrepid.
Write code to develop features, fix bugs, and create proof-of-concept prototypes across multiple projects, primarily using C# and .NET framework.
Integrating Okta's authentication platform into multiple applications to modernize SoftPro's security and user authentication experience.

work.summary: Credit Suisse is a Fortune Global 500 company that specializes in asset management and investment banking for clients. As as Technical Analyst for Credit Suisse, Kevin was responsible for:
highlights: Leading a team of nine technical analysts to define, design, and deploy a new solution for the Risk Metrics devision.

Acting as the Lead Developer for a six-developer project for the Amelia AI team, migrating their AI-based support bot to a chat-overlay client that greatly increased the accessibility of the Amelia help bot
Saved Credit Suisse an estimated $2M/year in support and maintenance expenses by acting as the primary developer for a C# middleware service.

projects.name: CoderNotes
projects.description: A search-based workflow for developer notes
highlights: Developed using modern web development technologies such as front-end JavaScript frameworks, back-end APIs, and integrations with 3rd-party APIs

projects.name: Software Ideas
projects.description: A market research service for software companies.
highlights: Responsible for three production codebases, from a simple marketing website in Laravel/PHP to a complex members-only web application.
Gained experience with Engineering-as-Marketing, a marketing strategy that involves creating free software to attract users to a website.
